greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of compositions (ordered partitions) of n such that some part is repeated consecutively 2 times and no part is repeated consecutively more than 2 times.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
maple: b:= proc(n, l, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(`if`(
i=l, 0, add(b(n-i*j, i, k), j=1..min(k, n/i))), i=1..n))
mathematica: Table[a[n], {n, 2, 50}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 21 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)

nmax = 50; Drop[CoefficientList[Series[1/(1 - Sum[(x^k + x^(2*k))/(1 + x^k + x^(2*k)), {k, 1, nmax}]) - 1/(1 - Sum[x^k/(1 + x^k), {k, 1, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x], 2] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 07 2020 *)
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Jan 23 2004
